name: BASBL
body:
Table of Contents
=================

  * [Motivation](#motivation)
  * [Why BASBL?](#why-basbl)
  * [Manual](#manual)
  * [Test Problems](#test-problems)
        * [OR using Pathogen:](#or-using-pathogen)
        * [OR using Vundle:](#or-using-vundle)
  * [Contact](#contact)

----

### Motivation
Solving _nonlinear_ bilevel problems to global optimality is a long-standing challenge in optimization theory. 
Special cases of bilevel problems, such as problems of _linear_ (_quadratic_) â€“ _linear_ (_quadratic_) type, have been studied extensively and many algorithms have been proposed in the literature ([Dempe, 2002](http://dx.doi.org/10.1007/b101970); [Floudas and Gounaris, 2009](http://dx.doi.org/10.1007/s10898-008-9332-8)). However, the general nonconvex form is very challenging and only recently the first deterministic method was proposed by ([Mitsos et al., 2008](http://dx.doi.org/10.1007/s10898-007-9260-z)).

### Why BASBL?

**B**ranch-**A**nd-**S**andwich **B**i**L**evel `BASBL` solver is a [MINOTAUR](https://wiki.mcs.anl.gov/minotaur/index.php/MINOTAUR) solver for nonlinear bilevel problems.
`BASBL` is based on a recent Branch-and-Sandwich algorithm (see [References](https://github.com/basblsolver/manual/wiki/References) section for the theory behind him) which guarantees to solve a broad class of bilevel problems to global optimality. Moreover, `BASBL` is enhanced with several new techniques: reduction of overhead of the UB procedure, alternative ways to calculate tighter bounds, as well as alternative choices for branching and node selection. 

__Important__: `BASBL` solver is still under active design and development and not feature complete or ready for consumption by anyone other than software developers.

### Test Problems

Description of nonconvex bilevel test problems in `AMPL` format, compatible with `BASBL v0.1` is provided on [test-problems-wiki-page](https://github.com/basblsolver/test-problems/wiki). This __wiki__ provides:
  * Errata List for test problems taken from [(Mitsos and Barton, 2007)](https://www.researchgate.net/publication/228455291_A_test_set_for_bilevel_programs)
  * The formulation of the problems and brief analysis of the feasible set and how the optimal solution can be obtained. 
  * Helpful illustrations of the objective functions and geometry of the problems

:page_facing_up: A Test Set of Nonconvex Bilevel Problems (2015) Zenodo. 
[![DOI](https://zenodo.org/badge/19541/basblsolver/test-problems.svg)](https://zenodo.org/badge/latestdoi/19541/basblsolver/test-problems)

### Support or Contact
Having trouble with `BASBL` solver? Check out our [documentation](https://github.com/basblsolver/manual/wiki).
